At first I had trouble figuring out how to turn this head set on and start using it. The battery was not charged enough and no blinking light ,blue to red appeared. I then hooked up the USB charger into the charging compartment and I was on my way.It attaches to the back of the head and loops over the ears. I use it indoors mostly so I have not really taken advantage of the phone sleeve for the arm,which I plan too.There was a software update online which I took advantage of right away.It connected to my memorex speaker system with amazon blue tooth box.It is true that it does allow you to hear things in the environment,making it almost safe to use it outside. I always think that is not the best way to compromise safety. I use it at home while others do not want to listen to my music.The unit is modern flexible with barnacle shaped ear buds.I had to laugh at myself trying to put it on top of my head instead of from the back-oh well...

This is a nice size charger cube that works well with my iphone.  I travel a lot, so I appreciate the small size and the retractable plug.  I lost my old charger, but like this one so much better.  The old one was bigger and could break into two pieces.Pros:~quick charge~ducl plug, so I can charge my phone and one other electronic device when I'm on the road~small size fits easily into my bag when I'm traveling~the "plug" folds in so you have a nice cube that doesn't catch on things in your bag~great priceCons:~

This wall charger provides a fast charge for two devices at once. It's much faster than using a laptop to charge another device. The prongs fold so it's easy to stow.It runs pretty warm, but I think they all do.Wall charger by Vinsic.
summary: Fast charge for 2 devices at once

reviewText: What more than that can you ask for?  I'd buy this again.  It has total output of 2.4 amps so you can't charge two devices at high rate at the same time.  But I knew this before I purchased it and this meets my needs.
summary: Works great, delivered on time, great price

reviewText: This is a small but solidly built two USB wall plug. What I like about it is not only tiny but the prongs fold in for storage. It has smooth, rounded edges as well so tossing around a purse or briefcase and it won't scratch other things.It worked well for charging most of my devices. It did my Samsung Galaxy S4 phone, Kindle Fire, another regular phone, and speakers. It did not charge my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 tablet but that is not unusual. It is pretty proprietary in the plug.Small and nicely built, a good product at a good price. I was provided a unit for testing and review.

Switching-mode USB charges just keep getting smaller and smaller. When my new iPhone arrived last year I was struck by how tiny the charger was, but now here's a charger about the same size, with the same capacity, for a quarter the price.My iPhone charger died a week after I got it. This charger has been charging my iPhone for half an hour, and it hasn't heated up at all. Is it better than the Apple charger? I don't know, but it seems every bit as good, and at a faction of the price, it's a much better deal. (Disclosure: I received mine as an unsolicited sample from the seller.)

The Vinsic cube is almost identical to the size of the original Apple iPhone charger, except for a little chamfered edge on the bottom.  There are two main things it is better than Apple's own cube.  For one, it can charge two devices at the same time with the two USB slots.  The second, it has foldable prongs which is handy and ideal as a portable charger. Fold the prongs and throw it in your purse.  No annoying prongs.I notice it is becomes warm while charging.  So, far not really hot to alarm me.  The only remaining question is how durable will it be.A sample of this product was sent to me for review purposes.
summary: Two advantages over Apple's own cubee.

reviewText: Literally this little speaker can go anywhere--use it in the shower as the ultimate invigorating wakeup to hear your favorite tunes each morning (better than coffee!), take it with you camping or to the beach, put it on your bathroom mirror, use it in the car--you name it.Where you need a bluetooth speaker, you now have one.More importantly, the sound is clean and clear, even above a loud shower or outside, it's intuitive and easy to use so it makes a great gift.  The shape is unique as well, being a triangle--adds a modern flair.Speaker provided by Shop Smart
summary: Waterproof bluetooth speaker with suction cup goes where you go, no wires

reviewText: I have never been one to enjoy singing in the shower, but I always appreciated being able to listen to the music on the beach. This small and effective portable Bluetooth speaker enables me to partake in both of those activities, and so I’ve discovered the pleasures of listening to the music in my bathroom.The speaker is very well built overall, with the rubberized outer shell covering most of its top and bottom. It has a big suction cup on the bottom that allows you to attach it to the shower walls or other smooth surfaces. The suction cup works well for the most part, although you will need to keep reapplying some pressure to it over time in order to keep the speaker in place.The speaker was easy to pair up with my iPhone. Once it is turned on it becomes visible in the list of Bluetooth devices. I am not sure how easy it is to pair it up with other smartphones, tablets, and computers but my guess would be that it should not be much of the problem either.The sound quality was pretty good, especially for a device of this size. If you end up mostly using it in the shower room then there will be some entirely expected audio distortions due to the small size of the surrounding space. There are also limitations to the sound quality of any device that uses Bluetooth standard for the signal transmission, but unless you are a very strict audiophile this will not be much of an issue for you. The speaker is also not very loud, so if your shower tends to give off a lot of noise then the speaker's volume might get drowned. (No pun intended.)I’ve used this speaker in the shower for a few weeks and so far have not had any problem with the water damage. If, however, something does go wrong at some point I will make sure to update this review.Overall I am very pleased with this speaker. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a small and convenient speaker to be used in the very wet spaces.**** Product sample provided for review purposes. ****

The first thing I noticed about this speaker, is the shape. It looks a bit like a flying saucer, and high tech. It is one of my favorite looking speakers that I have received recently, because it has a low profile, and sharpe modern look.The packaging says the unit is waterproof to 10 meters, but I am not going swimming with it. However, if it falls into the bath tub by accident, it is good to know it will not die. :)The controls could not be simpler, and the sound is good. Playback time is 6 hours, the charging time is 3 hours.This is a great deal at this price point for a waterproof speaker, and I was pleasantly surprised.I recovered a test sample to review, but the opinion is all my own.

This is a blue tooth speaker that is waterproof and designed to play while in the shower.  The speaker has a suction cup on its bottom that allows it to stick to the shower walls (or stick to just about anything).  The volume of these speakers, in my opinion, is not loud enough to be heard over the shower water.  I tested these speakers in the shower while listening to an audio book from audible streaming from my Samsung Note 2 phone.  Yes the volume can get loud but a shower can also be loud.Aside from using the product in the shower, this is a great product to carry around with you and use where ever you want to use it.  If you are outside and it starts raining, just put your phone in your purse then stream your phone's audio through these speakers and not worry about the water.  Of course you should not immerse this product in water but if a few drops hit it then it should be fine.The product comes with a 5V full sized USB cable (the other end is smaller and goes into the unit.  Once the unit is fully charged, remove from the power source.  Its build quality is pretty good too.  The speaker is extremely compact.  To power on the device you will need to hold down the ON/OFF switch for about 5 - 6 seconds.This is an excellent blue tooth speaker, just realize that the audio might be drowned out while the shower water is running.Based on the good price amazon is selling this product for and the fact that it ships Prime, I must say that this is a winner.  Just remember that amazon's prices are violative, and their prices can change daily.[sample provided]
summary: Waterproof, but may not be loud enough while in the shower

reviewText: Like the other reviewers before me I received one of these speakers as a review sample. Given the glowing reviews from folks whom I trust I am going to chalk mine up to a fluke. However, even though I am willing to give benefit of the doubt there are a few issues I have with it anyway.Here are the design errors that I have found and I do not attribute these to a lapse in manufacturing. First, the documentation is truly confusing. I did not need the instructions since I have used literally dozens of bluetooth devices, but a first time user is going to be frustrated. One example is the instruction that tells you to turn on the pairing button. There is no pairing button. It's a quick fix to correct that.The charging port is not waterproof by any stretch. In fact, I seriously doubt that it's moisture proof because the flap that covers the charging port is not a tight seal. Most waterproof charging port flaps on competing brands have a protruding rubber piece that inserts into the port, providing a dual layered seal. This has one too, but it's not tightly fitted to seal the port.Where I think mine may have been the victim of substandard parts and/or manufacturing are: the barrel connector does not stay in contact with the charging port. Any movement, however slight, will stop the charging process. Plus some of the buttons do not provide the level of tactile feedback that waterproof ones do. Some on this device do and some do not.General operation: it's not loud enough to compete with my shower, but the sound is very clear and the high, mid and low range frequency responses are very respectable.Bottom line: I am willing to concede that the manufacturing issues I listed are one-off flukes. However, there are some design issues that need to be corrected. When those are addressed this could be a five star speaker. As it stands, though, I cannot award it more than the three stars I gave (something I hate to do.) Hopefully version 2.0 will be significantly better.
summary: Mine may have escaped QA, but it is needs improvement

reviewText: When it comes to Bluetooth speakers, 5 years ago you'd struggle to find one at any price. Now they are everywhere, at very attractive price points. This one is one of the most attractively priced, and it's functionality reflects that as well.Charging was not difficult, but it uses a proprietary USB cable that is not a standard micro-USB. It's a pain to keep a proprietary cable around for all the devices that decide to go non-standard. I was not pleased with this.Pairing was not difficult, though the name of the device was 4 numbers, no name or anything. I thought that was odd, and something simple that down-marketed the device in a way that was unnecessary and probably nearly free to correct.The speaker did play and operate easily and properly with a voice included in the unit to instruct you when to pair, when actions are happening or waiting, etc.The volume of the speaker wasn't as high as others I've used, and when the volume is near the top end it gets to a slight blare. This wasn't very pleasing.So in the end, is it a value that functions? Yes! But is there also some room for improvement? Absolutely.
summary: Functional & affordable with room for improvement

reviewText: I received this at no cost in exchange for writing a review. I like everything about this product. Here are my comments.1. This is a compact (each side of the triangle is 3 1/2 inches) and lightweight speaker that is perfect for use at home or on the road. It comes with a 2.0mm pin charging cable, which is becoming more common. I already have several so no worries if I misplace this one. It looks good, better in person than in the picture on Amazon.Note: There is no manufacturer's or seller's name on this product. Sometimes that indicates a mediocre product that nobody wants to put their name on, but that's not the situation here. To the contrary, this comes nicely packaged in a hard clear plastic case that can be used to store this product as well as the included directions and charging cable. This would definitely make a nice gift.2. This has a suction cup that is very convenient for attaching this speaker to a shower wall or bathroom mirror or any other surface. The suction cup holds this firmly in place but is easy to remove from the surface it is attached to.3. Pairing this could not be simpler. Press the power button and a voice announces that this is entering pairing mode. I found it immediately on my iPhone bluetooth menu. Once paired a voice announces this.4. The controls are clearly marked, large and easy to use. A short press is used for forward and reverse when playing music, and a long press is used to lower and raise the volume. There is also a play/pause button as well as a button to answer the phone.5. The sound is really good for a speaker this size. Very clear and distinct, no tinny treble and no muddy bass.6. This passed my waterproof test with flying colors. I put it on the shower floor directly under the shower spray for 10 minutes while I showered, and for good measure poured several cups of water right on it. It continued to work just fine.7. At this price point this speaker is an excellent value. It works just as well as more expensive waterproof shower speakers that I have tested.Bottom line: This speaker is an excellent value. I'm going to use it on my boat this summer because I won't have to worry if it gets splashed. This will be a lot more convenient than what I have been doing, which is connecting a cassette adapter to my iPhone and inserting it in the tape deck of my marine radio.

The portable charger seems to be a growing category (are you listening cell phone manufacturers). As cell phones have gotten thinner and lighter, the battery life is just not what we need it to be. So, there is a need for a supplemental charge sometimes when you're out and about.  The Lifecharge Juicypack 2600 mah portable charger fills that need, but so do a slew of other "lipstick" chargers on the market.The device is simple and easy to use.  Mine is exactly opposite in color than the one pictured on Amazon (if that matters to you). It's blue on the outside and white on the inside.  It only has one port going out which is a low capacity, 1A port.  You cannot use this to charge a tablet like an iPad.For the simplicity, you give up some functionality. Given that these devices are used in "emergency" situations, you're not likely to use them often. Since they don't hold a charge forever, it's important to know when you throw it in your pocket how much of a charge it has. The problem with all of the lipstick chargers, not just this one, is they don't have a battery gauge on them.  So, you're likely to get out somewhere, plug this into your phone and find it has no charge.The product description on Amazon starts off listing Apple devices that this will charge. That is true. But, it will not charge them with the included cable. Apple devices have lightning connectors and this comes with a micro USB cable (as do most of these devices).  Someone needs to make one of these that comes with a lightning connector for Apple devices.

I worked in the field and require power for all the devices I use. Sometimes, I'll be miles from any power source and need backup external batteries that I can depend on. The external battery packs by Lifecharge have never let me down. In addition their versatility is as important as they work with all my devices, from cameras, laptop, to iPhones.I use the 2600 for keeping the iPhone and IPod charged and is powerful enough for me not to worry about them going dead. I use the 10400 for the more demanding devices like the laptop and cameras. Lifecharge external battery packs are an important part of our arsenal.Tough, rugged, durable are just a few of the words I can use to describe the device besides delivering the power when I need it the most. As an Author and Indie film maker, it is critical to have these on hand when working in the field and can testify that the battery packs by Lifecharge deliver when it counts
summary: External battery packs by Lifecharge deliver when it counts

reviewText: This battery pack might be small, but big enough energy to power any mobile devices.Having a 2600mAh battery places this battery pack in the lower range of battery packs. There is enough power to charge most cell phones once. I use it to charge my Note 2 and get three quarters of a full charge. Some might want more, but for its size it can not be beat.The size is very portable and can be easily slipped into a pocket or purse.The layout is very clean and simple with no moving parts. The design is great with two complementing colors of line blue and white. In the hand, it has a very solid feel, nice and sturdy. The size is similar to a large tube of "Lipstick".This battery will do the job to charge whatever you throw at it, and does it well. The best part is how small and powerful it is.I was supplied a sample for the purpose of review.

There are many external batteries out there that can help you recharge your portable devices, and which one you choose will depend on your particular needs. This LifeCHARGE 2600 mAh external battery/charger is one of the smallest I’ve seen, both in terms of physical size as well as charge capacity. The battery looks similar in shape and size to an elongated lighter. The battery is charged from an USB port, and it comes with its own micro USB cable with several different charging attachments. You can charge it by plugging it into a spare USB outlet on your PC (slow), or by using one of the wall USB outlets from your cell phone or a similar device.I’ve been able to use this battery to fully charge a Samsung Galaxy S3 phone and iPhone 4S. It took me a few hours to charge both of those devices. In order to charge an iPhone I had to use my own iPhone cable – Apple is very restrictive when it comes to allowing third party manufacturers using their proprietary designs.Since this battery is very small it is ideally suited for an emergency backup charging. It can easily fit in your pocket along with your smartphone, although I wish that it came with a small bag into which to put it.This is neither a particularly stylishly designed nor remarkably well built external battery. It has a very utilitarian look and fee to it. It gets the job done, at least for now. I have not tested it long enough to see how durable it is in the long run, and if I discover anything noteworthy about that I’ll update my review.Decent small external charger, especially for the price.**** Product provided for review purposes. ****

If you need a tiny battery pack, this is a good choice. It does the job fine, but you'll need the Apple cables because it doesn't come with them. Also note that it doesn't have LED indicators for the battery power. Both of these things being said, it is pretty inexpensive and did the job for me, so I'm happy with it!

Just what you need to fully recharge one phone, one time.  No bells, no whistles.  But you are not paying for any features that you won't use, either.  One feature that a 5-star, simple, convenient charger would have (and this four-star charger does not have) is a built-in USB cable.  With this portable charger, you will still have to lug around a cable.  Too bad:  A rubber band is so un-cool, but what else to do?It has two basic LEDs:  One is red and shows when the battery pack is charging.  One is blue that shows a fully charged battery pack.  Really, that's all you need if you are dealing with only one phone or small device and can get to a wall outlet or car charger before you need another fill-up.One tiny feature that I really appreciate, but don't often see on a charger:  It has holes at one end (not shown in any picture on this product page) so that you can insert a loop, so you can hang it.Now, if you need to recharge more than one phone at a time, buy a bigger unit.  A bigger unit will have a bank of four LEDs that will give you the status of how much charge is left for the next device that needs a fill-up.  A bigger unit will also weigh more.For those of you who do not like in-your-face logos marring the fronts of your possessions:  Notice that the Lifecharge logo is very big and bold and black.  It definitely detracts from the smooth lines of this design and the black ink on the bright blue plastic cheapens the look.One thing I noticed that was interesting--and may be why different people get different test charge results:  I charged it up the first time, until I got.the blue fully-charged light, then unplugged it, but did not use it.  Plugged it in a few hours later, and it showed a red not-fully-charged light.  So I left it plugged and in an hour it showed blue again.  I unplugged it and did not use it.until the next day.  I checked the charge, and it still showed blue.  So, for some reason, when charging for the first time, it did not accept a 100% charge.  The second time it did.  I'm no electrical engineer, so I don't know why.*I received a sample product from Lifecharge.

I don't use my cell phone every day, and  I've pulled it out of my purse several times to find it dead.  A portable charger has become an indispensable accessory.  I won't be without one.The Lifecharge 2600 Mah Portable Charger means I won't be stranded anywhere.  Since I live in a small rural community, that's invaluable.  Flat tires, winter's icy roads, dead batteries are not things I ever have to worry about, as long as I have my Juicypack and AAA.It takes the charger about three hours to fully charge.  There are flashing lights that stop flashing when it's fully charged.  There is a USB cable included which will serve to charge the charger by way of a wall outlet charger, and will serve to charge an Android phone with the charger.  You'll need an Apple cable for an Apple device.  That should be no problem as most of us have way more charging cables than devices to charge.There's no way to tell how much juice is left in the charger, so you'll need to plug it in every so often to make sure it's fully charged.For less than $20, this gadget could mean the difference between life and death.  This is not a keychain gimmickry gadget.  I was provided a sample for review, but if Lifecharge wants it back, I'd purchase one.  It's well made, solid, and makes me much more confident about traveling lonely country roads.
summary: Peace of mind in a small device

reviewText: This 2600mAh charger is lightweight and handy. It will charge an iPhone more than once with a full charge. Because it's so small and light, you can slip this into your backpack or bag and have at least a full charge in case you run out. This is one of those new chargers that have protection against over charging and over heating. Overall a very useful external battery pack. Sample was provided for review purposes.

This is a cute charger that fits easily into a purse, without taking up a lot of room, or perhaps a dash or console in a car.  It's convenient if you are at work or on the go and your phone needs a charge.  I charged it completely for about a day, then later used it with my Kindle to take it from hardly any time left to a full charge. I used it to surf a bit while it charged and it took about two hours to get a full charge, which was about as fast as the wall for me, though my battery is getting older.The blue is a cute color and it does exactly what it is supposed to.  It's very basic- there's no flashlight on it and there's no charge indicator.  It would be nice to know how much of a charge is left - that is a feature on more expensive chargers that I have, but it's affordable and very mobile if you want to just be able to charge back up during the day.  It comes with a USB to micro cable.I received this as a sample for purposes of review.  I would recommend it if you need an affordable, very mobile, portable basic charger.
summary: Fits into purse, good for a complete charge

reviewText: This nominal 2600 mAh power bank is small and easy to use.  It is only 3 1/2 in. long and has an eyelet that can hold a ring so it can be attached to a lanyard or keychain.  It is 2,600 mAh and will provide a practical 2,000 mAh,  more than enough to give a full recharge to a 1,440 mAh iPhone 5 or a 1,470 mAh Kindle Paperwhite. The body is tough plastic and a USB power cable and legible user guide are included.It is the most uncomplicated power bank that I have tested.  There is a red LED indicator while charging and a blue LED indicator when fully charged.  There are ports for power in and out.  There are no buttons or other complications:  just charge it by plugging the cable into the micro USB port and then plug an electronic device into the larger USB A port to automatically charge it.  This makes it ideal for youngsters or anyone who is not technically inclined.LifeCHARGE provided a power bank for evaluation and review.
summary: Small, lightweight, and easy to use

reviewText: This is more of a convenience than a tool for power users, but is still a serious tool. It has a relatively low capacity by today's standards, and is strictly a battery back up. Some brands include a built in flashlight, but those can be a two edged sword because it's easy to deplete the charge using it as that and not having back up for your phone when you need it. This model eliminates that.When I mentioned that this is relatively capacity I am putting it into the context of the high capacity batteries that seem to have flooded the market this year. Although it's low it can still add a lot of use time to your phone (or even tablet). I usually multiply claimed capacities of these batteries by .9 to get a more realistic charging capacity. That makes the review sample that I received is actually about 2340mAh. This accounts for losses from heat, charging cables and the charging process itself. Even with that you still get an additional 150% use time on an Apple iPhone 5S that its 1560mAh internal battery provides. I tested this on that phone, a Samsung Galaxy Note 3, and an iPad 2. This charger is about as fast as the OEM wall chargers that come with those devices.These batteries come with a charging cable and a no-frills indicator comprised of LEDs that simply indicate when it's charging and when charging is complete. It took me about seven hours to fully charge mine. It does come with a cable for charging the unit itself, and the cable can be reversed to charge any device that accepts a micro USB connector.Power users will probably scoff at this battery, but if you are among the 95% of use who need extra capacity only occasionally this is not only more than adequate, but compact enough to fit a purse or pocket. If you need something with more capacity I suggest checking out theLifecharge Juicypack 10400mAh Portable Charger.
summary: A major convenience with no frills

reviewText: If your cell phone battery seems to be running out of juice faster than it was before, an external battery pack can be a great immediate solution.  The Juicypack 2600 is one of the lipstick types, pretty small and extremely portable but can provide a full charge of emergency battery when you need it.  Just do not forget your phone's cable.You can recharge it in two ways.  Using an AC USB adapter, which is the faster way, or through your PC's USB slot.  To charge your phone, simple plug your phone with its USB cable the the battery pack's USB slot.  No need to press a button as it automatically starts charging once connected.It is interesting that this battery pack has a lanyard hole but no lanyard included.The Lifecharge 2600 comes with a white microUSB cable and a short user's guide.
summary: A full days charge in your pocket

reviewText: A useful emergency power backup for your cell phone.  My wife is using this as an emergency backup for her Nokia.  Kept in the purse it provides backup while she is at work.  She can plug her phone into this as she continues to make her rounds.  With a mobile work life she can not just sit down and plug it into an outlet.I received this for free.
summary: Useful backup for your cell phone.

reviewText: I often find that if I am using my smartphone heavily, the battery will not last an entire day. I find myself no where near a plug and have a dead phone of my hands. In such cases carrying reserve battery power is a must. This LifeCharge 2600 mAh is a nice reserve battery to top off the charge on your smartphone. At 2600 mAh, it has the capacity to completely recharge many smartphones. The nice thing about this is that it is compact in size and will easily fit in your pocket. I like this for daily use, as it is easy to carry around in your pocket.If you are hiking, camping or other activity that would take you away from power for more than 1 day, I would recommend considering a larger unit, like the LifeCharge 10,400 mAh unit. However, if you just need to periodically top off your charge, then this 2600 mAh unit is just the ticket, as it is small, compact, and easy to carry.(NOTE: I was provided a sample for review purposes)

Lifecharge Juicypack 2600 mAH portable charger comes in a unique smallish design for everyday travel. The two charging indicator are great for charging and fully charged.I tried charging- Samsung Galaxy S4 phones- Olympus Voice Recorder- A 4.5" SmartphoneThe microUSB is used to charge this powerbank and the USB itself to charge other devices. The charge will hold enough to power a Samsung Galaxy S4 once.I tried charging Samsung from no charge to 100% and following is time it took approximately for each of 10 minutes.10% = 7 minutes20% = 8 min30% = 9 min40% = 10 min50% = 11 min60% = 13 min70% = 14 min80% = 15 min90% = 19 min100% = 22 minSample provided for a fair and honest review.

The Lifecharge Juicypack 2600 mAh charger is small and light enough to be easy to carry wherever you need it. There are no controls - just plug in a USB cord (a short one is included with a MicroUSB plug on the other end which can be used either for charging the battery or powering a device) and it turns on. I found it was rather slow in charging my iPhone 5S, at about 2W, but with the smaller capacity I would not expect a higher charging rate. It did the job, though I found it took a long time to recharge the pack itself. The manufacturer sent me the charger and asked for a review.
summary: Compact power when you need it

reviewText: I received this at no cost in exchange for writing a review. Here are my comments.1. This is a basic "lipstick" charger that comes with a micro USB cable for charging.2. The back of the box says a full charge time is 6-8 hours, which is pretty long for a unit with such a small output.3. I fully charged this, then used it to charge my iPhone 4S from 70% to 96%, which took an hour. Acceptable, but not impressive.4. My main issue with this charger is that there is no way to know how much of a charge is left. There is no button to press to make the two indicator lights go on. Inf fact the indicator lights didn't go on at all while I was charging my iPhone.So after I charged my iPhone 4S I had no way to know how much of the charge in this unit had been depleted. To me that's a serious design issue. I'm not going to carry a charger that I can't randomly check to see how much of a charge is left.Bottom line: This works, but unless you charge it daily, you can't be sure how much of a charge is available should an emergency arise.
summary: No way to see how much of a charge is left

reviewText: Sometimes just having a charger cable for your phone or tablet just doesn't cut it. You aren't always near a wall socket or something else that can charge it, and if there's an emergency or you need to get something done, the situation seems hopeless. With a reliable external battery though, you're all set, and that's exactly what the Lifecharge Juicypack is. This is the first external battery I've used, and I've been impressed with how it's performed so far. The only device I've used with it is my Samsung S4 Mini, which went from 8% to 100% in a little over two hours. That's a huge difference from when I charge it through my computer, that's for sure.I'll be honest and tell you right now that I don't understand what all the numbers associated with this thing stand for. 16800mAh seems to be at the top of its game though. The charger features two USB ports: 1amp and 2.1amp. According to the instructions, one's for tablets and the other's for phones. Between the ports is a micro USB cable port for you to charge the unit itself. Also included on the same side as the ports is a little LED flashlight, activated by pressing the power button twice. It's not that strong, but still has its use like trying to find ports on a computer in a dark area or something.The LED display on the charger is great, and shows you how much power is left in the unit. This thing takes a while to charge. Right out of the box it was at 68%. I had it charging through a computer for 2 hours and saw that it was at 75%. Fully charging it once it's reached zero is going to take some time.Size-wise, the Juicypack is great. It's just 12 ounces, and isn't much bigger than the average phone. It's well-built and solid. The only concern I have is that mine was brand new, yet had scuffs all over the metallic border around the LED display. Maybe I just somehow got a refurbished one? It's also worth noting that you'll get over 500 recharge cycles with the unit. It might not sound like -that- much, but it's more than enough since, if you're like most people, you'll be charging your device the regular way. Don't use this just because it's convenient!All in all, I highly recommend this battery to anyone who's going to be going on a trip somewhere as an emergency backup option, or just to have in your car just in case. It's just a few bucks more than the standard version that doesn't have the display screen, so why not spend the extra money?
summary: More useful than a pack of Juicy Fruit.

reviewText: I travel a lot, and keeping power-hungry devices working during long international flights is always a challenge. Over the years I have purchased a wide variety of power packs, which all did a reasonable job at keeping my phone charged. The highest capacity ones were even able to recharge the iPad 1 almost fully. However, things got bad when I upgraded to the iPad 3, which is an incredible energy hog, so I was eager to see how the Juicypack performed.The Juicypack is a little bigger than a portable hard drive (3" x 5 3/4" x 7/8") and hefty (12.5 oz). The case is made of black matte plastic with a white edge surround. The top features two USB connectors (2.1A and 1.0A), a microUSB connector for charging, and a white LED. A power button on the right side turns on the power and toggles the very bright LED. Finally, a backlit LCD display in the front reports usage and percentage of remaining battery power. The package contains the battery pack and a USB to microUSB cable, which can be used for charging the Juicypack as well as powering a device.I ran a test by first fully depleting the battery on my iPad 3 (I played movies until I got successive low battery warnings, 20%, 10%, 5% left, and then the iPad shut itself down) and fully charging the Juicypack.I then plugged in the iPad into the high power charge port and waited until it reported 100% charge. When it was done, I was floored to find out that the Juicypack reported 48% capacity remaining. Looking at the numbers (the iPad 3 battery capacity is close to 12,000mAh) and taking into account the necessary loss of power during conversion and charge, it's likely that 48% is a little optimistic, still the simple fact that the Juicypack was able to give the iPad 3 a full charge and have power left to spare is extremely impressive -- none of my other chargers has been able to do that, except the amazing but much more expensive Zendure A6 (which is not yet available on the market anyway, I bought mine by backing the Kickstarter project)Now, you will be able to find here and on ebay battery packs that advertise much higher capacities (22,000mAh) for a third of the price of this unit. I urge you to pass up on these -- they do not deliver anywhere near the amount of power they advertise, and do not last.PROS---------- MASSIVE amounts of power on the go- quality construction- convenient numeric display of percentage of charge remaining- built-in flashlightCONS---------- Charging is slow, it can take up to 10 hours if the battery is fully depleted- Heavy (but it has to be to pack so much energy)THE VERDICT--------------------A very impressive and capable battery, one of the best out there. The iPad 3 test was enlightening! If you travel with power-hungry devices like tablets, it belongs in your gadget bag. Very highly recommended to all road warriors and nerds.(I was provided a free sample in exchange for a fair and unbiased review)
summary: The first battery pack to tame my iPad 3 (with lots to spare)

reviewText: This is a super conveinant charger/battery that snaps right onto your phone, easy cheesy!  Fast charge and also doubles as protection should you drop your phone.  Highly recommended!I was gifted the above charger for my unbiased review.

I can't comment enough on this.  Sooo many times have I found myself in a podunk pitiful airport that hasn't been updated to the 21st century and our electronic needs, to find my phone almost dead.  Either tripping over the folks sitting along the pathways who have discovered the 2 sockets just outside the elevator and finding myself desperately looking for another...This occasionally happens on road trips in the car as well.BUT I think you get the picture...HOWEVER, this is a lifesaver (conveniently named Lifecharge)!  It's holds a massive amount of charge.  I've charged my phone (Iphone) and a friends phone (Blackberry) several times, left it sitting for 2 weeks and it's still has 42% more "juice" in it.  Heck I could probably start my little car with it.Anyways...There are two USB out ports and 1 universal mini USB in port.  I would pack this in a backpack or briefcase as it's got a good weight to it so it's a no go for the handbag (unless your in a hurry).  Nonetheless, it's as versatile as heck.  I'm not a gadget collector and I don't have tons of electrical stuff, BUT when my phone loses it's juice, I will panic looking for a way to charge it.For those of you who use a menagerie of electronics, I would say this piece of equipment is worth every penny to keep you charged up and going.FYI...I received this product from the manufacturer in lieu of a fair consumer review.
summary: Lifecharge can be a Lifesaver...A great gadget to invest in:)

reviewText: The power pack field must be awful;ly competitive these days, because we're frequently offered samples to review.  But this is, hands down, the best we've ever tried.Our 12-year old son is the techie of the bunch and inquisitive as all get-out, so he's always the first to try new equipment.  Aftyer his first charge on this unit he came racing in to show me--on the very convenient and easy to read LED display--that the pack still had 90% of its power left and, in his words "charged his iPod crazy fast."It is bigger than other units we've sampled, but no bigger than an old transistor radio or Walkman : about the size of your hand.  It's slightly heavier too, though nothing like to heavy for travel.  If you put it in a pants or jacket pocket you'd notice it.  Tuck it ion your luggage or backpack and you won't.It has two USB ports for charging your devices and you charge it off of your pc or plug in via an included micro USB cable.It's a winner.
summary: The Standout in a crowded field

reviewText: Over the past few years, I’ve reviewed several external batteries – each with its own favorable features and power capacity. The LifeCHARGE Juicypack 16800mah should be considered at the top of the list. It’s LED power percentage readout sets it apart from other external batteries, because you can see in an instant your power reserve. That’s golden on the road. I also love the size of this unit. It fits the hand well, and it’s sleek enough to slide into a slim briefcase without looking like a smuggled brick. Granted, the Juicypack is not the most powerful external battery out there, but what it lacks in power it makes up with smarts, intuitive design and two outputs to charge the devices I use most often – my iPhone and iPad. Quality is built into this product with protection against overcharging, as well as 500+ recharge cycles over the life of the battery. Highly recommended!(A sample was provided for me to render an unbiased review)

This dual port portable power bank is a beast that delivers 16,800mAh to mobile phones and tablets simultaneously through two ports (1amp & 2.1amp). It is sturdy, relatively compact, well constructed of aluminium in an elegant and attractive design. At 7.75" x 3.1" x 1" (146mmx77mmx23mm) size and weighing 12 oz (340 g), it is more suited to carry in a bag/attache than in a pocket.A large clear LED display indictes the level of power within the unit, which takes 6 to 8 hours to full charge - my device charged to 100% after 6.25 hours when connected to wall plug. It took 4 hours to fully charge a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 and an iPad 2 simultaneouly. Only a 2USB to microUSB cable is included (in the easy to open clam shell box). An added bonus is a small narrow beam LED located between the ports that is activated by pressing the "ON" button n the side.Compared to similar power banks in its category it is heavier, priced relatively higher, and lacks different cords/adapters to fit the various devices it purports to charge. Personally, I like it enough to include it in my everyday electronic armamentarium.A complimentary sample provided for review.

Very nice, inexpensive screen protector for your iphone 4,4s. Can't tell the difference between my actual screen and this. Goes on easy and bubble free! Super easy to install and lays completely flat and stays where you put it! Hasn't shattered and protects my screen completely! Great product!
summary: Best type of screen protector you can get for your iphone 4, 4s~

reviewText: Fit the phone perfectly, Product was just as described. Would buy from again.
Love it, makes my Iphone 4s shatterproof, very useful when kids are playing with phone. Also it fits perfectly. love it and great value!

Wow!  This is fantastic. I was a little skeptical when I ordered this because I have had several different screen protectors for my iPhone 4s and although they all protect my screen from scratches, I ALWAYS have at least a few bubbles and they drive me crazy. I know bubbles are better than scratches but I wanted clear and clean as well as protected and now I have it. This is tempered glass, it LOOKS and FEELS exactly like the real phone screen. This  screen protector works greatIt was very easy to apply ,fits great ...no  bubbles.....all I wanted  and more ....no more oily prints on my screen now...........shipping was very fast with my Amazon prime ,arrived packed well......
This is magnificent! Easy to install, Must have! Wish I had this sooner. Brilliant product, comes with everything to place perfectly and alcohol swab to clean so it attached perfectly!

This is a nice variation of the typical powerbank in that it can be recharged using solar power. It has its limitations, however – recharging only by solar is very slow and can take several hours to build up a decent charge level. But if you don’t have access to power, such as while camping or in an emergency situation, any ability to recharge can be hugely helpful.The overall build quality seems very good. It has a good heft to it, and it is encased in a water resistant frame that is also shock resistant. The input and output ports are covered with rubber flaps to keep out dust and moisture. I really like that the flaps are attached to the body to prevent me from losing them.The overall size is pretty compact. It’s just shy of 3 inches wide and about 5.5 inches long. It’s very thin (about  inch thick) making it pretty convenient to take along in a backpack or even a large pocket. It comes with a clip ring so you can hang it on a strap on a backpack.The output ports (2 of them) are located on the top on either side, and provide a 1A output. There’s also a micro USB input port for conventional recharging. It has a 4 LED “gas gauge” to show the power level remaining.No complaints at all regarding performance. It recharged my phone and mp3 player without a problem, and still had about 50% capacity remaining. The 5000mAh capacity means this is best for small devices but, in a pinch, you can also use it for a larger device, such as a tablet, albeit the charge speed will be slow and you probably won't be able to fully recharge the device before the powerbank is empty.While it’s priced higher than a conventional powerbank of the same size, the solar recharge option makes this a better choice if you’re looking for something that can be carried along for camping or hiking, and still maintain the ability to recharge it even when there’s no power.[Sample provided for review]

I like the way that my charger looks - the blue is a pretty light blue that matches several of my other phone accessories.  It comes with a 10 inch cable (not including the ports) and an adapter that you can use to make the USB mini-port turn into a USB to I-phone adapter.  I put it in the window and it charged up , to full, a little green light came on and when I plugged it into my Kindle, all 4 blue indicator lights came on and it charged my Kindle completely as fast as if I'd plugged it into the wall.The solar panel looks durable and nice - it's not shiny and cheap looking like some are- it's more matte and it's tight without a lot of cracks so it is rain-resistant.  This is actually the first solar cell I've seen out of a material that is matte like this - I like it a lot.  Most are shiny and a bit static-y and attract dust, this one doesn't.It comes with a hook so you can hook it on a backpack or purse.  It has 2 usb ports and a mini-port in in case you want to charge it with the wall.  I've only used the solar charge so I can't say how it works on AC.There's also a small LED flashlight.  It's not big, but it's helpful to find keys or unlock a door in the dark.  To turn it on, just tape the power button twice.  It turns off the same way.I was given a sample for purposes of review.  I do like and would highly recommend it.  It's very stylish and pretty, and it absolutely does what it is advertised to do, easily without any effort- just put it in the light, and it charges and works.  It's very simple.

This charger provides emergency solar charging when no other power source is available. The approximately 5.5 by 3 inch device is a 5000 mAh portable battery that is normally charged using its micro USB port and the included cable connected to any full size USB power port. It will take 5 to 7 hours to achieve a full charge in this manner, with the four blue LED lights showing progress in 25% increments. Once fully charged, the device can fully charge two USB devices at the same time using the two USB ports, one on each side of the handle. It charged my almost fully depleted iPod 5 in just over a half hour and showed 50% capacity remaining.There is a single green LED to indicate when the battery is charging from sunlight, which goes off when complete. When solar charging is used to recharge the battery, the matte finish solar panel that covers the front of the unit only generates 200 mAh which is about a 1/20th of what a normal USB connection would provide (4000 mAh), so it would take several days in the sun to achieve a full charge from a complete discharge. The solar capability provides an important backup lacking in conventional auxiliary battery devices.I actually had an occasion when I needed to make a call and found that both my phone and battery pack were out of juice. With this product, you can be sure that it will never be completely discharged by giving it time in the sun each day, and even if it is completely discharged, a little sunlight will get you enough charge to make a phone call. Don't leave it in a closed car in direct sunlight, however, because it will not work in temperatures over 113 degrees Fahrenheit (45 degrees Celsius).Along with its emergency solar capability, the charger has an attractive rubbery liner surrounding the solar pane l and covering the back. The USB ports are concealed behind rubbery hatches and contribute to making the device dust and water resistant. There is a small oval opening in the rounded top in which the included carabineer can be attached for ease of transport. The charger has a smart combination of handy features -- handsome, powerful, lightweight, water, dust resistant, compact, and rugged.A power cord is included (USB-A to micro USB) and an adapter was provided to fit iPhone 4/4S phones. Solar charger provided by eBoot.

When I received a review sample of this battery pack I tested it out of the box. Mine arrived close to one hundred percent charged, so I was able to at least test the simultaneous charging capability by connecting my Galaxy Note 3 phone and Tab 3 10.1 tablet. Both were in the ninety percent charged range and both were at one hundred percent in less than thirty minutes.Of course, the key feature is the ability to recharge the 5000mAh battery in this unit using solar energy. After I discharged the battery to about fifty percent (indicated by two remaining lit LEDs) I tested that capability. Even on a slightly overcast day it took about ten hours to charge it up the remaining fifty percent. Not bad to be honest.There is a charging port that allows you to more quickly charge this from a wall or car charger. That process can take five to seven hours, but it's a major convenience when you are preparing for camping or otherwise going off the grid.Some of the features that impress me about this battery is it's designed to be water and shock proof. More importantly, the status lights show at a glance the capacity (in twenty-five percent increments), and the charging state from either solar or wall power sources. For me it's reassuring to see the light indicating that the unit is, in fact, charging up via solar.I will not say that it's indestructible, but it's definitely sturdy and will withstand a lot of abuse in a harsh environment. For that reason, and because it works per claims made in the product description, I am giving it five solid stars. It's in my vehicle as an emergency item just in case.
summary: Well thought out design for camping and harsh environments

reviewText: I took the eBoot solar charger power bank with me on a week long camping trip.  Our cabin was devoid of electricity, so I relied on this power bank.  Instructions note that the solar charging is just for emergencies, that it should not be left in the sun for prolonged periods of time.  I had to wonder what a consumer would expect buying a solar charging power bank if it weren't to be be left in the sun.  How long is too long?  So, I left it out to charge.  Seeing that the battery level was not moving up above one bar, I did what any normal person who doesn't read instructions would do and left it out all day, every day.  After a full day of bathing in the sun (sometimes shaded by trees but I tried to move it to full sun when I saw that), the power bank has enough juice to give my HTC One a 10% charge.I've had experience with larger solar chargers, so I didn't expect much more, though I did hope for it.  Even three and four panel fold-up chargers take a bit of time to fully charge a 5000 mAh power bank.  This power bank is the size of a large cell phone.  There just isn't enough surface area to catch the solar energy.  Instead, we can charge this power bank with a USB cable, which is what I do most of the time.  When it's fully charged, I can give my HTC One a 100% charge.This is a rugged power bank.  The ports are covered, and there's a carabiner for hanging off a backpack.  It's good for camping, but don't rely on the solar panel.  If you have an emergency and wait all day, you can get enough power from the sun to charge your phone, search for a signal and call for help.This product was provided for review by eBoot.
summary: Real World Test on Camping Trip

reviewText: This is really a unique idea. To be able to take a photo from your phone when you're a few feet away. It's as good as a regular camera and works well. You don't install anything. It's simply a button like you would press if you were near your phone. It works over bluetooth, so easy to use and easy to pair. A really unique device.

I've been using this BT013 Aukey Bluetooth Speaker for about a week now and so far it is working wonderfully.I love how this speaker has a unique look compared to the every day round/hamburger speakers.Please checkout the pics I uploaded!Charging time only took an hour when I received the speaker. (charging by USB)The quality of this portable speaker is excellent. The bass is decent as well for it's size.I used it with my Samsung Galaxy S4 and iPhone 5 without any issues at all and easily paired.Sound quality wise, it was much better than my friend's SHARKK Portable Bluetooth 4.0 Mini Speaker.The packaging provides cushioning from all around the speaker itself.Contents:SpeakerCarrying PouchAux cableCharging Cable (micro usb tip)Manual (of course)The speaker itself looks great.It has rubber feet at the bottom to prevent slips.The volume button/pause/play buttons are easily accessed on the side of the unit.Power switch/Charging port/Aux ports are nicely hidden in the back.Blue led lights up in the front to show it is ready to pair with your smartphoneThe volume of the speaker allowed it to be heard even in the next room.Will be blasting music with this and watching movies/shows also.Overall, this speaker does great for it's size and works great.Hope this is helpful to ya!
summary: Sounds great for it's price and workin well!

reviewText: When I first received this speaker I could not realize how small it was. The speaker comes with everything that is needed including a micro usb charging cable and an 3.55m auxiliary cable. It also comes with a nice pouch for traveling. The range and sound on this bluetooth speakers are amazing. I was able to move from my living room to the kitchen and the sound was not distorted. The sound for the size and price is great. Like other reviewers said the sound will not replace expensive wired bluetooth speakers but for the price you can not beat the sound quality. The speaker is able to hit all types of sound with pretty decent quality. The speaker plays a sound when you connect your phone to it so you know it is connected. The speaker itself also has a pause and previous and next button so you can control your phone's music directly from the speaker itself. Overall this is a good buy!

I just got the Aukey Gemini Portable Bluetooth Speaker and I must say I really do like the design of it.  The speaker has an elegant classic looking design and blends in really well with its background.  The speaker offers versatility in connectivity with options of using a 3.5mm Aux port, cable included, or connecting via Bluetooth.  The speaker uses Bluetooth 2.0 technology, although Bluetooth 4.0 is the newest revision, no discernible impact is noticed.The speaker has an on/off switch so you can turn the speaker off when not in use.  I actually like the switch instead of having to hold in a button.  A lot of the Bluetooth speakers I have seen have a button you press to turn off and on but I find that a switch is more user-friendly and quicker.  When you turn the speaker back on the speaker will automatically pair with the last device, also a feature not all Bluetooth speakers have so this is great to see.  The speaker also has volume control buttons on the side of the speaker which can be used to adjust the volume or change the track from the speaker itself.Some specifics about the speaker itself:• Allows for distances up to 33 ft between device and speaker when using Bluetooth.  The distance before distortion is experienced will depend on obstructions between the devices. I have the speaker in the kitchen and play music from my phone with distances between 10 to 15 ft away and have yet to have any issues, sound is always clear and crisp.• Two 3W drivers.  The two 3W drivers seem to offer a noticeable difference in bass when compared to other Bluetooth speakers I have used.  You can hear a noticeable difference in the sound and can play the music at higher volumes without crackling.• Built-in rechargeable lithium battery offering up to 10 hours of usage• The speaker also has a built-in Mic for hands-free usage.  I tend not to use this feature as I am use to holding the phone when talking on it. But this option is an added benefit of this speaker.  When you get a phone call the speaker will pause and notify you of the call via a ringtone.• Non-Skid rubber pads on the bottom of the speaker• All required accessories included: carrying pouch to protect the speaker if using it when traveling, 3.5mm cable, micro USB charging cable.Overall, this is a great speaker.  The size of the speaker is not bulk and sounds great for its size.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, my review is fair and honest.
summary: Great Sound and Low Price for a Bluetooth Speaker

reviewText: This is an impressive mini speaker for the price. The build quality is excellent – it looks and feels much better than I expected it would given the price point. It feels very solid to the point where it’s hard to tell if the case is plastic or metal. The seams are tight and the edges are all nicely rounded. All the control buttons have a good feel to them (although they could be better marked, as noted later in the review).The grill is gray which blends well with the overall black-on-black look. It has a nice overall shape – a curved top and a curved front which gives it a very elegant look. The only thing that I feel detracts from the overall look is that the top has a gloss finish. Looks great when it’s shiny; but it is a major fingerprint magnet.It has two large non-slip grippers on the base that are very effective in keeping the speaker planted on a desk. The overall size is pretty compact – it’s about 5 inches long, 2.5 inches wide at the widest point (the middle) and stands about 2 and 3/8 inches tall.It has the usual bluetooth connectivity plus the ability to use a 3.5mm cord to direct connect it to a tablet. Both methods worked just fine – pairing was quick, and using the cord to connect was simple. The bluetooth range was very good with no dropouts at 20+ feet. I’m especially pleased with the bluetooth pairing sound – rather than a grating beep (or, worse yet, spoken prompts) this has a very nice (and quiet) chime.The sound quality was quite good. It’s not a “big” sound, but it performs admirably given the size. As with the build quality, it sounds far better than you would expect given the price. It does get somewhat harsh at loud volumes, but at normal listening levels it puts out a fairly clear sound with a decent amount of bass.It also offers phone functionality with a built-in mic. I didn’t test that, so I can’t give feedback on its quality.It comes with a very nicely made carry pouch and a manual that actually is readable and helpful.Complaints are few. As noted previously, I’m not a fan of the glossy top. I also wish the side controls for volume were better marked. They work fine, but it’s almost impossible to see which side of the rocker switch to press. Not a huge deal, but I prefer clear markings even if it detracts a little from the overall black-on-black color scheme.There’s a lot of bluetooth mini speakers out there, but this stands out with solid build quality, sound and looks. I’m happy with it, and would recommend it.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Good sound quality; excellent build quality; attractive design

reviewText: The Aukey BT013 Bluetooth speaker is a very well built, compact speaker, that has a robust sound considering it's size.  The unit has two 3W drivers, so the sound fills my office.  The unit is a great size so you can take this speaker anywhere.  It fits right in my backpack, or briefcase.The bluetooth was a simple connect with my IPhone 5s.  It automatically pairs now when I turn on the unit, and connects to my phone.If you don't have bluetooth, or prefer the sound of a wired connection, there is a 3.5mm audio cable you can plug into any device.It also makes a very good speaker phone, for Skype or regular calls.The units rechargeable battery enabled me to use the unit for 8 hours of straight playtime at about 40% volume. Very impressive.The unit really is a very nice looking speaker.  I like that it has rubber pads on the bottom so keep it from slipping or scratching my furniture.At this low price point, this speaker is a real deal.Sample provided for review.  However, the opinion is my own.

reviewerName: Rick " The best of everythng " "The b...
reviewText: Just back from a little 4th of July excursion.  I was fortunate enough to have taken with me the Aukey BT013 Bluetooth external speaker.It arrived almost minutes before pulling out for the Independence Day weekend travel.  I was surprised it made it in time. This was two days from the order point.  The Aukey packaging is a step above average.  Although the theme is brown box. The packaging is tight with crisp folds with internal cardboard support structuring. Included in the BT013 package are one handy user manual, one 3.5mm speaker auxiliary cable, a USB2/micro (Like you find on Samsung), and a microfibre drawstring bag.Charging was simple enough. Plug in the micro USB cable and a Red light comes on in the grill of the speaker.  After a while the BT013 is fully charged and the red light is extinguished.First use was painless in that I turned it on, My Samsung SGH-i727 reported a BT013 in range.  I tapped that on the 727 display and it was paired with no further fiddling.  Drivine to the first holiday destination I was reviewing audio notes about some captured video with unuseable sectons of audio totally blown away by wind and or firecrackers.  This was interupted by a couple of incoming calls.  Which were handled well by the Aukey BT013 speaker's built in internal microphone pickup.Re-pairin is simple as the BT013 powers up paired to the last device.  Turn it on and if the device is in range it connects within a couple of seconds.  At one point it was necessary to Re-pair the BT013 with a 10"pad for a mini theatre.  Just BT-off on the i727, BT-on on the pad, and push and hold the special button on the side.  You can answer a call with this button, the button above it is volume -/+ and skip forward/backward. Holding the special button a couple of seconds causes the BT013 to enter pairing mode again and can be paired to an alternate device.The compact size is easy to deal with, it takes very little space on the desktop in front of the monitor, or in the courtesy console in the land yacht. It takes up very little space in its storage bag in my mobility package.  It was nice it came with a 3.5 inch audio patch cable one extremely low end tablet that came with us besides virtually no volume did not have bluetooth and the BT013 saved that low end tablet from the trash for the trip.  If I were to think on it for a bit, the only drawback would be the 8 hour battery time.  I did not depleate the BT013, but would feel more secure if it had a longer rated time between charge cycles.With the clear audio and excellent microphone pickup I will definitely get a lot more good use from this device.  As a final testament, I had to spend a half hour on the cell phone to a service rep for a well known product distributor.  It sounded like they were a bad burger drive through, I could barely understand anything she had to say until I flipped on the Aukey BT013.  It cut through the over amped signal from the rep and made it possible to complete the service request without being reduced to a drooling screaming fit.

I love this speaker. The design is incredible. It feels light weight and the way the buttons are placed are good. You can change songs on the switches on the side. The sound of the music is no disappointment. You get all you need to be able to charge this and it comes with a nice carrying bag, too!

The Aukey Bluetooth Speaker is very compact but that certainly doesn't mean that it doesn't pack a punch! I love that it is wireless and the sound is far reaching. It works on the Bluetooth Version 2.1 +EDR or higher. It works on such items as iPad, iPhone 2 or higher, iPad Touch and MAC and it worked fabulous on my Samsung Galaxy S3 smartphone. The bluetooth was a very simple connect and pairing w/ my Samsung Galaxy S3, and I tried it w/ my iPad Air and iPad 2 and all worked great as well. If you prefer a wired connection or don't have bluetooth you can use a 3.5 mm audio cable that's included that you can plug into ANY device you'd like.The sound for a speaker this small is totally amazing.The fact that it's able to be recharged and holds a charge while playing for hours on end makes this unit worth every penny. We had a family get together here at the house and we played it for over 7 1/2 hours (I timed it) without having to recharge it at about 60 % Volume..TOTALLY unexpected .For $21.99 you won't find anything better for your money.I did test this on Skype to see how it would work as far as a speakerphone. it worked amazingly well for this purpose as well.I did obtain this product at no charge in exchange for my honest testing of this product and my honest review and opinions. These opinions are my own and were not in any way negotiated with the owner of the product. I do plan on buying a few more of these speakers for family members for the holidays as I was totally impressed not only by the sound quality but also by the look of the product that stands out. For it's size it definitely packs a punch.
summary: Aukey Gemini Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker Really Packs a Punch! Fabulous Sound

reviewText: Wow.. I was so impressed with the look and build quality of this item when I received it. I needed a classic, elegant Bluetooth speaker for use on my desk in my office. I deal with customers all day long and wanted a subtle but classy looking device that would sound and look great. This fits the bill perfectly. I simply cannot emphasize how nice this piece is. The build quality, the look and sound quality are all top notch. Pairing was easy as pie. Simply turn on device, discover with your phone, hit pair and begin to stream your music collection. The size of speaker allows for discrete placement on any flat surface and the rubber feet keep it in place and prevents vibration from ruining the sound. Simply plug in when leaving for the day and it will fully charged in the morning when you arrive. I LOVE THIS DEVICE! Great value and great looks. I would recommend to family and friends in a heartbeat.

reviewText: I found this screen protector just as easy to install as advertised. No bubbles. No tricky positioning. It just went right on smoothly and easily.One thing I appreciate about this protector is the texture it offers my phone's screen. It's not slick, it's not rough, but it has a smooth feel under my fingers that I find to be an improvement over the feel of the glass itself.One thing I don't appreciate (and this is admittedly a very minor gripe) is the slight edge the protector creates around my home button. If I didn't have a 5S I probably wouldn't mind, but using the touch-id with this protector on isn't as pleasant on the fingertips as using touch-id without it.

These glare screen protectors fit the iphone well and just slip right on.  The box they come in doesn't provide a small cloth to clean the screen with, which I was surprised about.  However, the protectors work well and they even double-up one on top of the other well.

At first I wasn't sure I received the product that was request. The label says it is "Transparent Film for iPhone 4/4s - 2 pack", while another label says "Belkin 2-Pack Anti-Glare". So, I'm not sure exactly is this is Belkin's product of Micra Digital's. When I opened the box there was actually two packs of two films, so wouldn't that be a four pack? Confusing, isn't it?Like I said, there are two packs, each containing two films inside the carton with an instruction card only with diagrams, no text. You can see these instructions in the photos section of this product, so I guess maybe I did receive the correct product. You start by cleaning your iPhone with a cloth that is not supplied, so I'm not sure if there is a specific type they want you to use. Next, you peel off the plastic backing, and throw it in the trash. What they don't say is to flip the product over so the sticky side is facing down, which is obvious, but some people may not realize that. Then you have to be good at aligning the product so that the holes all line up. This takes a steady hand and a great deal of patience. Once it is in place, press it down using the cloth again over the entire surface. It is easier said than done. The first time I tried, I got more bubbles than blank screen - it was terrible. I ripped the first one off and trashed it. By this time it was full of dust and could not be re-used. The second application went a little bit better. I got far fewer bubbles, but the fact that there are any bubbles is annoying, especially since the product description says "Specially formulated adhesive for super-easy installation that will be bubble-free!". Further instructions in the product description say "Then with your fingernails, gently push away any small bubbles that may remain."  - this did not work. I still have bubbles that I cannot get rid of.UPDATE - After using my iPhone for a day after applying the film, most of the bubbles are still there (though some have gone away), and now there are a lot of smudges too. These films certainly are not smudge proof.While the film helps cut down on a little glare, by no means will your screen be glare free, and the screen will not be as brilliant as it once was. What I have noticed though is that text does not move up and down the screen as smoothly as it did without the film attached. It kind of has a quick stuttering effect as it scrolls, which might be annoying to some. There appears to be tiny dots visible on a white screen, which may account for this. I did not notice any drop in screen sensitivity, and the film gives the screen a silky smooth feel. Other than that it is what is. Installation can be luck of the draw, and seems somewhat prone to bubbles. For about the same price I like theZAGG invisibleSHIELD for Apple iPhone 4/4S (Screen) - Retail Packaging-Clear, which I had on my phone previously. It comes in several different types, has a Lifetime Guarantee (you pay a small shipping fee), but they will send you a replacement, and they last for several years.
summary: It is what it is - not the best - not the worst.

reviewText: I used this to replace the brand-new screen protector I got at my phone store.I prefer this product, as it is much better for a number of reasons.FEATURES:Easy to put onVery clear imageNon-glareSmooth surface (not like some that feel rubbery and are hard to slide your finger over)Great Value (comes in a pack of 4)This is a great screen protector.
summary: This is a great screen protector.

reviewText: I had tried many screen protectors when I first got my IPhone5 about 18 months ago.  My favorites were the matte finish ones from Tech Armor.  I switched over to a clear glass cover so as to enjoy the enhanced clarity of my screen and images. However, I found out what most users of glass screen protectors discover - they smudge really easily - and I was getting tired of cleaning it each and every time I picked it up to use it!Then, along came the offer to try out these Anti-Glare screen protectors from Belkin. Belkin is a very reliable name in the manufacture of after-market IPhone accessories, so I was sure they were worth a try. They weren't.Like others have mentioned, after trying with 5 of the 8 I received (free via Amazon Vince to try and review) I gave up. I found a pack of the Tech Armors in my desk and in one easy motion, applied one with no bubbles or dust specks. Problem solved.Simply put: Belkin does a lot of things right, but this is not one of them.**(I presume that Micr-aDigital is a division of Belkin as the names are used together in the invoice that accompanied there screen covers. If they are not, I apologize to Belkin, but not for the content of this review.}
summary: Simply Put: **Belkin/ Micra Digital does a lot of things right, but this is not one of them.

reviewText: This anti-glare screen is fairly ordinary.  It is difficult to get rid of the bubbles.  While some competing products come with microfiber cloth to clean the Iphone, as well as a small card to wipe away bubbles...this one comes with nothing.  Just the screen protector.  It is okay, but nothing special.

These Micra Digital 2-Pack Anti-Glare Screen Protector for the iPhone 5/5s/5c need improvementI mean, they apply right onto the iPhone just fine and do a great job keeping the screen protected but there is just one problem - the air bubbles are impossible to get rid of.The set didn't come with instructions, so there's no directions on how to get rid of them.Polaroid makes a better Iphone 5s screen protector

These aren't the most anti-glare screen protectors out there, but it went on easy enough and stayed on without lifting in the corners, so far after more than a week.  This came in Amazon frustration free packaging, with a very basic set of instructions, and no cleaning cloth or applicator, like some other sets do.  I did use a lint free cloth on the screen after cleaning it, and an applicator from my last screen protector to smooth out the bubbles as I stuck it on my phone.  Overall, a pretty basic, middle of the road set of screen protectors.
summary: Micra Digital 4-Pack Anti-Glare Screen Protector for iPhone 4 / 4S

reviewText: This is about as good a screen protector as you'll find today.  It's just about like the others on the market.It is more shiny than the anti-glare screen protectors I've used previously, not the matte finish you can get from, say, Belkin or iLuv.To apply the film to your phone, you have to peel the film partially off the backing, align the holes with the holes in the device and peel the rest.  Then you remove the bubbles with fingernail or the stiff cardboard applicator they include.  Many screen protector kits come with a little scrap of micro-fiber cloth to clean the phone screen.  This one did not include that scrap.The film is extraordinarily transparent -- really, you can't see it.  That makes it very hard to align.To think about aligning it, it seems a simple procedure. To do it just right -- not simple.  They provide a second film to use if you mess up the first try.  You can't just pull it off and try again with the same film.I'm waiting for screen protectors to come with alignment devices that prevents getting them on crooked.An alternative is to get the film applied by one of the kiosk shops in a Shopping Mall that sells screen protectors.  Soon, I expect, the actual glass surface will be tough enough that you won't be able to scratch it, no matter what.  But glare may always be an issue outdoors -- and this Micra works.  The iLuv works. The Belkin anti-glare one works.
summary: Does not have the applicator I'm looking for.

reviewText: I went into this feeling pretty confident. I'm a neat person and I felt capable of installing a screen protector, especially since all three people who reviewed this before me said it was easy and there were no bubbles. Those people are complete freaks.I put on the first protector. I couldn't get it to line up exactly, so I repositioned it three or four times. When I put it down, there were bubbles GALORE. No way could I smooth them with my nails. I tried, but then also tried using a credit card. For ten minutes, Finally gave up and decided I'd try a second protector (I had a pack of 4). The same thing happened.I decided I must not have cleaned the screen enough, so I did it again, even though it looked perfect. Absolutely not a speck of dust on the screen. I put the third screen protector on and made sure not to reposition it this time. Again, there were bubbles, and this time I paid close enough attention to see that the bubbles I couldn't get rid of all had a speck of dust in the middle. How?! The phone was spotless and all I'd done was remove the protector's backing and stick it right on.Down to my last protector, I gently eased it off its backing and looked at it in the light. It had dust on it! On the sticky side of the protector, which you can't wipe off. So I washed the darn thing with soap and water and waited for it to air dry and then tried again. And again. And again. I washed all of the screen protectors and tried different methods... shaking them dry, patting them gently with cloth... whatever I did, dust jumped right onto the protector's sticky side within moments.FOR TWO HOURS, I was driven to homicidal rage by these screen protectors that gave my iPhone the measles. Three of them are now in the garbage, and the fourth will be in the garbage tomorrow when I make it to the Verizon store and make an employee put a new screen protector on for me.
summary: The people before me are sorcerers

reviewText: I just purchased an iPhone 5C. I usually get my screen protectors from the Verizon store along with the car charger and case. This time around, I skipped buying anything extra because I was in search of a different type of screen protector. Lately, I've been having a hard time reading the phone screen inside and outdoors. I really wanted to try this one due to the anti-glare factor. The package comes with two protectors. As for installation, it was a snap to put on. Just peel and place! As for the results, you can immediately see the difference compared to a regular screen protector. Definitely worth it!

never heard of this brand as I've typically purchased a name brand screen protector or from AmazonBasics. The cutout for this screen protector is very precise and no weird shapes, and was easy to apply and the quality was clear - not too matte. would definitely recommend.
